snippet: The Hewlett Packard chief and Republican fund-raiser said Mrs. Clinton had reached out to her about a month ago, one of the first indications that the Democratic nominee is courting Republican leaders....
abstract: Hewlett Packard executive Meg Whitman, leading Republican fund-raiser, issues blunt statement criticizing Donald Trump, calling him demagogue whose candidacy could endanger United States; Whitman pledges to vote for Hillary Clinton and says she will work to raise funds for her campaign.
lead_paragraph: The Hewlett Packard chief and Republican fund-raiser said Mrs. Clinton had reached out to her about a month ago, one of the first indications that the Democratic nominee is courting Republican leaders.

headline.main: Meg Whitman, Calling Donald Trump a ‘Demagogue,’ Will Support Hillary Clinton for President
headline.print_headline: A Top Republican Donor Says She’ll Vote and Raise Money for Clinton
